definitions.definition: At or towards the front ; in the direction one is facing or moving.
examples: Just ahead you can see the cliffs.

definitions.definition: So as to be further advanced, either spatially or in an abstract sense; to be superior.
examples: He finished two laps ahead of me.
In all of his classes Jack was ahead .
There may be tough times ahead .
You've got to think ahead so as not to be unprepared.
Set the clock ahead an hour.
Push the deadline ahead a day, from the 20th to the 21st.

definitions.definition: At an earlier time; beforehand ; in advance .

examples: Push the deadline ahead a day, from the 21st to the 20th.

main_definition: At or towards the front ; in the direction one is facing or moving.
secondary_definitions: So as to be further advanced, either spatially or in an abstract sense; to be superior.
At an earlier time; beforehand ; in advance .
